column4: hi! ok folks, everything keeps crashing. fresh 7.10 install. I just installed to a newly formatted partition. no hdd error. no cpu error. no memory error. what is this? even terminal crashed. I lastly thought it could be the video driver somehow and changed the driver vesa. the X went black and linux _freezed_ it didn't take in ctrl-alt-del or backspace... can anyone try and help me here maybe?
please anyone help me!
can you run memtest for an hour so without crashing?
yes I do. I didn't wait the whole memtest thing but I think I've waited 1-2 hours at least.
from your description I would guess memory problems.. could be overheating too
I have 1 gb ram and a 2 GHz + cpu
7.04 worked fine for weeks and after that i updated
so everything crashes? any messages in syslog? (tail /var/log/syslog) ?
sensors shows my cpu is 25 C
25C sounds very very low.. almost broken low =)
it's for amd, for intel it would be 45 C
anyway no errors in tail of syslog
it's not crashing always... it's only sometimes
not when you run some specific software?
not. everything crashes and not always but randomly.
but for example xchat-gnome _always_ crashes and pidgin seems to crash much more than firefox... 20 to 1
hmm.. very strange.. so.. it isn't memory.. it isn't overheating.. disc failing slowly?
my hdd should be ok, and I tryied different partitions too
I'm out of solutions then.. if there are no errors logged and no pattern in what software crashes it might as well be aliens...
I thought it's maybe my savage4 video card somehow... i changed the driver to vesa and all went blank... linux simply died. what could this be?
there are a couple of chassgames available.. look at eboard for example
